reviews.text:
We kwamen hier in de avond eten op een weekdag. Reserveren is misschien wel nuttig. Want het restaurant zat helemaal vol.

Alles wat we hebben gegeten was zeer lekker. De porties waren wel groot, dus delen is aangeraden.

De service was ook zeer vlot en vriendelijk.

Since they moved to new location service has kind of been slacking. The atmosphere feels to touristy not the hole in the wall hidden gem like there old spot. No complaints about the food. Just know itâ€™s strictly cash (maybe easier to launder money) and they add 18% tip on top of your order.
Buena comida
I've been coming to this place since 2016 because the food is very good, but the bathrooms are always too dirty. It's a shame that they neglect this area, as it's part of providing good service.
on s'y rÃ©gale de dumplings et autres incroyables plats chinois, mon adresse prÃ©fÃ©rÃ©e de Chinatown

i dunno never been to america or joes shanghai but ill give it a 5 anyway because joe sounds like a nice guy

Recomiendo esta opciÃ³n en el barrio chino. Comimos rico, abundante y a buen precio. El lugar estÃ¡ bastante bien ambientado, limpio. Nos atendieron muy rÃ¡pido y estuvieron muy atentos. El plus de ofrecer agua y la naranja de 'postre' es un buen detalle.
Food was great not crazy expensive and we love sharing the table with unknown friends

FRIED PORK! Ok so apparently they are extremely known for their soup dumplings which we obviously orderedâ€¦ and yes they were very good. However the fried pork entree which we split amongst 6 grown men, was by far the best pork I have eaten. The pork was served with a side of salt and sauce. Mouth watering and fried to perfection. The restaurant is very big and was packed which is always a good sign. I have nothing but amazing things to say. My one suggestion is to ask for a side of chili oil. Not too spicy but just enough kick.
make too leate evry time

We ate lunch here on 10.19.2025 (see attached bill). Dumplings tasted weird, my guess is because of the poor quality of pork. General Tso chicken was hard. They bring you food and the check â€“ this is extent of their service. But they put 18% gratuity automatically into the bill, which is insulting. Overall â€“ no atmosphere, no service and mediocre food. I will avoid this place in the future.

My friends and I recently visited again, after a long time. The taste and general ambiance has not changed. The food was served super fast, tasted good, and the place was packed but felt very comfortable. All i would say is the entres are family size and lo mein is a bit salty, so be prepared... but everything else we ordered was perfect.

The food is disappointing.

We had high expectations on the soup dumpings and it was not good at all.

Noodles were a bit overcook and the food was overall not worth it.

Honestly the food was not good. We went there for the soup dumplings and they were bad, the soup seemed like oil and water with no flavour.

The place is nice and the service was good but the food was just not there
Wonderful place! Great food, lovely staff, spacious. As good as it gets!Have been going to Joeâ€™s for 55 years,
Amazing soup dumplings. Good noodles.  No line to wait.  I believe this is a cash only establishment.
ë§¨í•˜íŠ¼ ì°¨ì´ë‚˜íƒ€ìš´ ì¤‘êµ­ìŒì‹ì

Overall, a nice place.
Itâ€™s not a fancy restaurant, but a simple one with good service.
The food was tasty, and the atmosphere was pleasant â€” a bit noisy, but thatâ€™s just the vibe of the place.

Joe's is OK at best. Honestly, I'm not sure what all the hype is about. First they seated us and made us wait over 15 mins to order. While waiting, guests seated after us had their orders taken. Ok, fine. The food was good, or so it seemed. We got pork soup dumplings, scallion pancakes and General Tso chicken. The dumplings were the best of all 3, the pancake was slightly overdone and the chicken was on par with neighborhood General Tso's, i.e. just average. My biggest problem with the food came the next day, today, as I write this. Their offerings were unkind to my stomach to say the least. I would avoid if you cannot risk dealing with mild food poisoning the next day.
Best soup dumplings and great food.
ZjedliÅ›my tu bardzo dobre pieroÅ¼ki z zupÄ…. PrzystÄ™pne cenowo, miÅ‚a obsÅ‚uga. PÅ‚atnoÅ›Ä‡ tylko gotÃ³wkÄ….

Essen war ok, nichts besonderes. Wobei sie wohl fÃ¼r ihre Peking Ente bekannt sind, diese hatten wir nicht.
Man kann keinen Tisch reservieren, sondern wartet einfach drauÃŸen in der Schlange und bekommt Wartenummern. Drinnen ist es sehr voll und laut.
Aber dafÃ¼r sind die Portionen wirklich riesig.
The food was pretty disappointing, seafood was not fresh on the  seafood pasta, beef was way too sweet on the orange beef, service was not that pleasant either.
The crabmeat dumpling here is amazing, thes best Iâ€™ve tried.
Miss the atmosphere of the original location on Mott street
Great food, great service, cool atmospher.

Dissapointing... Went there for a late evening finishing dish...

We had:
1. Braised beef cold apetiser
2. Vegetable dumplings
3. Shrimp soup

We disliked:
1. Mediocre, fatty piece of Beef with acceptable taste, as a cold starter tastes relatively weak, no side at all, would go well with a sauce or vegetable, bun...
2. Missed sou sauce or any other sauce, very plain
3. Absolutely tasteless, no seasoning at all, we left most of it untouched...

Appalled by the first 3 dishes, decided not to go for the main.

Absolutely appalling for such an expensive chinese restaurant.

The only really tasty thing was a Heineken, which came to the table only after a second reminder to the waiter...
Such amazing food, staff and atmosphere! Will definitely be coming back!

Cash only! ATM is upstairs by the bathrooms. Grab a spot before dinner rush for a quiet meal. 4-5:45 pm is a sweet spot! Scallion pancakes, steamed potstickers, and Sweet & Sour chicken are family favorites. Elevated flavors, with simple ingredients that shine.
Authentic food or so says my friend from China
Joe's is an experience. Small groups or large. Get there before dinner rush if you don't want to wait in line. Try everything. It's all good.
What an amazing first experience in china town! Food was phenomenal and the service was great.

Stopped here for the soup dumplings and they did not disappoint! They were
incincredibly delicious and flavorful! The service was quick and friendly. They are very popular so there was a little bit of a wait but its definitely worth waiting for! They also only take cash but do not worry because there is ATMs on site. That being said yoj definitely have to stop in here for the soup dumplings! The general tso chicken is also delicious a little heat with quick nice sweet crunch! Definitely would go back!

I recently tried Joeâ€™s Shanghai and the food was amazing! The chicken was incredibly tender, and the sauce was packed with flavorâ€”it really stood out. The white rice was perfect: soft, fluffy, and not clumped together like it usually is at other places. The portion size was generous, easily enough for two people. Overall, a delicious and satisfying meal. On top of that, the delivery guy was excellentâ€”prompt, friendly, and made sure everything arrived hot and in great shape.
The best Chinese food!!! 10/10!
A little rush after you finish the plate. I didn't like the idea of only cash, it's very inconvenient for the tourists. Food wasn't what I was expecting. Overall is good.

Nowoczesna restauracja, ceny przyzwoite, obsÅ‚uga ok.
PrzyjechaliÅ›my tu ze wzglÄ™du na sÅ‚ynne pieroÅ¼ki  :) nie sÄ… zÅ‚e warto sprÃ³bowaÄ‡ ale ten smak trzeba lubiÄ‡. Porcje sÄ… spore wiÄ™c warto nie zamawiaÄ‡ zbyt duÅ¼o, tylko zjeÅ›Ä‡ i domÃ³wiÄ‡ coÅ› wiÄ™cej.
ReasumujÄ…c bÄ™dÄ…c na Chinatown polecam odwiedziÄ‡.
Muy mal no les recomiendo nada ahÃ­ en ese restaurante

Always great Chinese restaurant!
Never disappoints, share big portions family style

What happened to Joe's Shanghai! It used to be SOOOO GOOD but the soup dumplings are so bad. Very sloppy job. We ordered 4 orders of crabmeat soup dumplings and some of the soup are even spilled out and the flavor is lacking. Very watery and not good at all. We also the peanut sesame cold noodles and there was a tiny piece of plastic in there but we didn't even bother saying anything. We order their special shrimp in honey glaze sauce, it was okay. It's sad that Joe Shanghai's soup dumplings went down tremendously. Very disappointing.

The food is still good specially the soup dumplings however the place lost some of itâ€™s charm. I miss the gold fish at the entrance, no cleaning the table with tea, many standard seating and no spinning round tables. I used to love it that you are randomly seated with people at a table and sound the hot sauce to each other. Also the location is now on a main road and not in the narrow streets. The more so called clean modern decoration doesnâ€™t work for me. Seems that the crowed also changed and is less Asian. I still recommend it if you love Chinese food that is good for western taste.
Salt and pepper prawn was excellent!!
Delicious food, Cash only! Get the pork soup dumplings.

The soup dumplings were flavorless but the pancake scallions were good. The only flavor I tasted came from the sauces. This restaurant is very gentrified restaurant and the target population seems to be white people.

Service was however good and they were nice.

The most unpleasant overstimulating rushed dining experience located in the heart of the most chaotic part of Manhattan. Bland unseasoned lukewarm food. Cash only establishment. We asked the waiter to give us five minutes to read the menu and he came back in one minute and said five minutes are up. Once payment was ready three different waiters came by and tried to take our check while my friend went to the atm to get the balance of cash needed ($1). I will not be returning.
I'm Chinese, this is a must for East Central Chinese food

Delicious food for a reasonable price, with fast service and comfortable seating in a large dining area.  The wait can be long on Friday and Saturdays, but quick during other times.  I always bring my out of town friends here for good soup dumplings.  Make sure to stop by the Citibank and Chase around the corner for cash beforehand!
Lively atmosphere. Get the dumplings. Fast and efficient service. Food was piping hot.

My husband has been wanting to come here since we arrived to NY.Â  We went this past Sunday night with two of our friends.Â  We arrived around 7pm and only had to wait about 15-20mins before they were able to seat us - considering this place is always busy and there's no way to reserve a table in advance it felt pretty quick to get a table.Â  We ordered a number of dishes to share, my favorites were the braised pork and the pork+crab soup dumplings.Â  We also tried the chicken fried rice, chow mainÂ noodles, more dumplings, and pancake.Â  This place is cash ONLY, so make sure you stop by theÂ ATM first.Â  It was a rainy and cold Sunday in NY so this was the perfect warm and cozy meal.

Sorry to see midtown west location closed. Then, this downtown location now moved to new location good progress.

One of the most reliable soup dumpling. Beef noodle soup and lo-mean also good.

Cash only. Line in weekend.
